Join the action

Want to play pool at Emakina?

  • Easily find available players
  • Enter your match results and get an official rating
  • Collect achievements such as "Schoolyard boss" or "Living encyclopedia" 
  • Compete for the ultimate reward: entering the Hall of Fame
  • Or just have fun and win a sexy t-shirt

    FAQ

     How can I get the golden belt?

    It is acquired by defeating the current owner in at least a best of 3 games match.

    For one pocket, the game being significantly longer, only a single game is required to win the belt.

    The champion has to defend his title and is encouraged to accept challenges. At least he shouldn't refuse them for more than a week.

     How is my rating computed?

    Each player starts with a rating of 1500 points.

    Ratings are updated after each match using the Elo rating system with a k factor of 32.

    Some explanations about the Elo system:

    • The k factor represents the maximum number of points you can win/lose in a single game.
    • The actual number of points depends on the difference between ratings:
      • For a victory against a similarly rated player, the winner gets 16 points (half of the k factor).
      • For a victory against a higher rated player, the winner gets more points as the rating difference increase, 32 being the maximum.
      • For a victory against a lower rated player, the winner gets less points as the rating difference increase, 1 being the minimum.
    • The points won by the winner is always equal to the points lost by his opponent.
      (Therefore, if the number of players is stable, the total number of points remains constant!)

    In a multiple games match, the k factor is multiplied by the number of games required to win the match (e.g. k=62 a "best of 3 games" match).

     

    Check wikipedia for more information about this clever guy named Arpad Elo.
